summary: This bill, the Department of Homeland Security Climate Change Research Act, mandates the Under Secretary for Science and Technology of the Department of Homeland Security to research and develop methods to mitigate the negative effects of climate change on homeland security. It requires evaluation of existing federal research, focusing on preparedness, emergency planning, and financial structures related to major disasters. The Under Secretary will consult with other federal agencies, state, local, and tribal governments, and infrastructure operators. The bill also mandates reports to Congress on research and development activities and defines climate change.
